etymology.description: 人(人) (rén, "person") + 十(十) (shí, "ten") = phonetic 十 with 人 providing semantic context of person-related inquiry -> final form 什(shén, "what")
etymology.interpretation: The character combines 人(人) (rén, "person") with 十(十) (shí, "ten"), utilizing 十 for its phonetic value and 人 to suggest a general sense of inquiry or relation to people. The combination appropriately reflects the interrogative nature of 什(shén, "what").

examples.chinese: 你想知道什么(你想知道什麼)，我来帮你找答案(我來幫你找答案)。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ xiǎng zhīdào shénme, wǒ lái bāng nǐ zhǎo dá'àn.
examples.english: If you want to know what, I will help you find the answer.
